*div1 type="summary"* *p*James W. Breediove to Austin, New Orleans, November 30, 1829. Thanking Austin for information about Texas. Rumors that United States is negotiating for Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-30-1829">Novr 30. 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir Your esteemed favor of the *date_mentioned n="10-12-1829">12 Oct */date_mentioned*came to hand by *person_mentioned*Captain Pettet*/person_mentioned* and for the valuable information therein contained be pleased to accept my warmest thanks, I have shown your letter to several of my *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*who are interested in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and they have advised me verry Strongly to have it published, this I have declined doing, as you had [not] expressed such a wish. Your letter has shed light on the subject of the Colonization Laws and regulations. which many *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*stood in need of and to such *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*I have taken pleasure in reading it. I shall feel under much obligation to you when I receive the promised translation of all the Laws on that subject as it will afford me the means of giving such information as is almost daily asked of me, as the *person_mentioned*representative of the Mexican Government*/person_mentioned* in this *location_mentioned*City*/location_mentioned*. The impression is rapidly spreading that the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* are now negotiating for the purchase of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*it may be without foundation, but it has already had the effect to cause many to look in that direction for a future *location_mentioned*residence*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*for your friendly feelings in recommending the *person_mentioned*Planters of your -*location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*to me as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to Transact their business accept my best wishes, and you may rely on my best exertions for the protection of their Interest whenever intrusted to my care;*/p*
*p*Should it ever fall in my way to render Service to the *location_mentioned*Settlement of Austin*/location_mentioned*, rest assured it Shall be done*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J W Breedlove*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. A *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*of mine *person_mentioned*Genl Smith*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Missouri */location_mentioned*is now here, and has a great wish to make a contract with your *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*for the Settlement of two or three hundred *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, and wishes me to Join him, he is a *person_mentioned*Gentleman */person_mentioned*of great Integrity and inteligence, and is in possession of Considerable means, he would visit *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, but his business Calls him to *location_mentioned*Mo*/location_mentioned*. he requests me to ask *location_mentioned*if the land originally granted to *person_mentioned*Edwards */person_mentioned**/location_mentioned*is vacant and also what Kind of a *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*Could be obtained in other *location_mentioned*Sections of your State*/location_mentioned*, and when your *person_mentioned*Legislature */person_mentioned*meets, and what are the requisites to be Done to make a Contract, your answer to those enquiries will oblige*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J W Breedlove*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed.] *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Austin Texas*/location_mentioned* Schr. Santa Ana*/p*
*/div1*
